update.description:
This is a resubmission of and continuation of [pull request 52](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/pull-requests/52/resubmit-the-mixtures-of-gaussians-code/diff) as the owner of that repository is no longer working on this project.

Outstanding issues/questions include:

* All tests will have to be modified due to the changes in ```input.master``` and ```params.*.params.*``` files as well as checked that they still give the expected segmentation.

Completed:

* The default varFloor value (when enabled) of 0.001 is arbitrary --> changed to 10^-5 based on discussion on segway-internal and convergence testing done on simpleseg
* Remove ```--zscore``` from this pull request and move it into a separate one --> see [pull request #69](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/pull-requests/69/using-zscore-to-normalise-datatracks/diff)
* Testing that implementation of multiple genomedata archives is working as expected
* Setting ```varFloor``` option to be turned on by default in all cases (if GMM) to ensure convergence
* Value of ```MIX_PSEUDOCOUNT``` (currently 1, suggested 100?) --> is now 100, as per discussion on segway-internal

Currently varFloor is passed to GMTK only if either specified (with or without GMM) or it's not specified and mixture models is run (in which case, a default value of 10^-5 is passed to ensure convergence).
update.title: Gaussian mixture models

content.raw: @ericr86 All tests have been updated
content.html: @ericr86 All tests have been updated

content.raw: @ericr86 @hoffman What is the recommended course of action regarding using the sublabels feature in conjunction with more than 1 mixture component? As pointed out on segway-internal, it doesn't seem to make a whole lot of sense. Should using the two features together raise a warning or an error of some sort?
content.html: @ericr86 @hoffman What is the recommended course of action regarding using the sublabels feature in conjunction with more than 1 mixture component? As pointed out on segway-internal, it doesn't seem to make a whole lot of sense. Should using the two features together raise a warning or an error of some sort?

content.raw: @rcwchan I've made some more comments/suggestions. Let me know when you've made revisions/comments and I'll review again.
content.html: @rcwchan I've made some more comments/suggestions. Let me know when you've made revisions/comments and I'll review again.

content.raw: Can this not be set in group.add_argument as a default value?
content.html: Can this not be set in group.add_argument as a default value?

content.raw: A constant, default value of None might be unnecessary. If you're always checking if `self.var_floor` has been defined (i.e. not the default value), you can simply write `if self.var_floor` instead of `if self.var_floor == VAR_FLOOR_DEFAULT`. This happens a lot throughout the code.
content.html: A constant, default value of None might be unnecessary. If you're always checking if self.var_floor has been defined (i.e. not the default value), you can simply write if self.var_floor instead of if self.var_floor == VAR_FLOOR_DEFAULT. This happens a lot throughout the code.

content.raw: Maybe adding `GAUSSIAN` here in the name would be clearer
content.html: Maybe adding GAUSSIAN here in the name would be clearer

content.raw: In the context of this PR this makes sense, in a vacuum it doesn't. Perhaps `GAUSSIAN_MIXTURE_WEIGHTS_PSEUDOCOUNT`?
content.html: In the context of this PR this makes sense, in a vacuum it doesn't. Perhaps GAUSSIAN_MIXTURE_WEIGHTS_PSEUDOCOUNT?

content.html: @ericr86 The discussed revisions have been made and are ready for your review again. Thanks!

content.raw:
Pseudocount for the DPMF table for the mixture of Gaussians. Corresponds to the 'dpmf_seg0_seg... dirichlet_num_mix_components...' table in the input.master and params files

Basically corresponds to a pseudocount for the weights of each mixture of Gaussians
content.html:
Pseudocount for the DPMF table for the mixture of Gaussians. Corresponds to the 'dpmf_seg0_seg... dirichlet_num_mix_components...' table in the input.master and params files

Basically corresponds to a pseudocount for the weights of each mixture of Gaussians

content.raw: @rcwchan I've made some comments/suggestions. Let me know when you've made revisions/comments and I'll review again.
content.html: @rcwchan I've made some comments/suggestions. Let me know when you've made revisions/comments and I'll review again.

content.raw: Don't use the term "GMM", a user reading this will not know what it means.
content.html: Don't use the term "GMM", a user reading this will not know what it means.

content.raw: Is this tied to a Gaussian or is it on a per-track basis? What about the "normal" case of a simple single Gaussian?
content.html: Is this tied to a Gaussian or is it on a per-track basis? What about the "normal" case of a simple single Gaussian?

content.raw: This is worded a little awkwardly. This option simply specifies the number of gaussian mixture components correct?
content.html: This is worded a little awkwardly. This option simply specifies the number of gaussian mixture components correct?

content.raw: Is there a check to ensure that var_floor is set to a value >= 0?
content.html: Is there a check to ensure that var_floor is set to a value >= 0?

content.raw: Can you name this more specifically? I'm not certain what the "MIX" here refers to? It is a Gaussian mixture pseudo count?
content.html: Can you name this more specifically? I'm not certain what the "MIX" here refers to? It is a Gaussian mixture pseudo count?
